posts.message:
rails geeks, :)

in a multi-lingual website, assets pipe-lining needs every css file to be precompiled, while we have at least 1 file to be conditionally added (ie: style-rtl.css) if locale == "ar"

I am looking for the "rials way" to get over it, all I could find is some suggestions for workarounds 

your advice is deeply appreciated

السلام عليكم

من فضلكم  انا شغال .NET MVC 

لو عاوز اعمل موقع يشتغل زى Google Drive - بمعنى انه حيتم تخزين ملفات عليه فقط لا غير وكل يوزر حيكون له ملفاته الخاصة بيه وكمان ممكن يخلى حد تانى من المستخدمين يشوف او يحمل الملفات الخاصة بيه او بعضها ؟

أنا بجد استفدت من الأدوات دي..

https://www.facebook.com/yasser.abd.rab.elrasol/posts/914261331992848

Reactjs and angular2 are not comparable. You may use a mix of reactjs and angular2. Angular2 is a framework for building SPAs. Reactjs is a library for building web components. So you won't find routers Api request helpers in reactjs but you'll find a lot of helpers coming out of the box with angular

posts.message:
"Proud" to say that this article confirms what I predicted almost 5 years ago when I first started learning about #linux

Before that day, I would have considered this all blasphemy, even though I had read "The Cathedral and the Bazaar " back in 2000, I still could not see it until 2011.

P.S. please before making any rash comments, read the article carefully and the articles linked by it.
posts.caption: zdnet.com
posts.description: 2015 was the year Linux and open-source software took over the IT world, but many open-source and proprietary software fans still haven't figured it out.

posts.message:
بما ان النهارده فيه مؤتمر مايكروسوفت للمطورين بعد طول غياب MDC، انا عاوز انتهز الفرصه ان لو فيه ناس من الجروب موجودين هناك يبقي ممكن ننسق مثلا في البريك اننا نتقابل في مكان معين، نتعرف علي بعض أكتر. 
اللي هيكون هناك النهارده وموافق يعرفنا في comment وتعالوا نخلي البوست دي ننسق فيها الموضوع هيمشي ازاي، وهيكون فيه بعد البوست دي واحده تانيه نحدد فيها مكان ووقت التجمع وفقا لما سيتم الإتفاق عليه. 
موفقين يا شباب :)
Hash Code is a team-based programming competition organized by Google for students and industry professionals (18+) across Europe, the Middle East and Africa.

posts.description: Team up to solve a real-life engineering problem from Google. Are you up for the challenge?
